arm_group.description: Non-returning catheter valve (UnometerTM SafetiTM Plus) was used in experimental group only.
Conventional urine bag hasn't the non-returning catheter valve.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study was to determine efficacy of the non-returning catheter valve for reducing
      catheter associated urinary tract infection compared with conventional urine bag in
      critically ill patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-returning Catheter Valve for Reducing CAUTI

detailed_description.textblock: Non-returning catheter valve (generic name) used UnometerTM SafetiTM Plus (trade name)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The participants who age more than 18 year and admitted to the medical intensive care
             unit or intermediate care unit

          -  All participants must be retained the urinary catheter.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The participants were diagnosed urinary tract infection before retention of the
             urinary catheter.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of Non-returning Catheter Valve for Reducing Catheter-associated Urinary Tract Infection in Critically-ill Patients

oversight_info.authority: Thailand: Khon Kaen University Ethics Committee for Human Research

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence density of the catheter associated urinary tract infection (CAUTI)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
